original_title: Bangladesh donates stock of 24 medicines worth USD1mn to Sri Lanka
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Essential Drugs Company Limited, the state owned pharmaceuticals company in Bangladesh, gifted a stock of 24 essential drugs sufficient for 3 months of Sri Lanka’s requirements, a statement by the government information department said.
Bangladesh High Commissioner Tareq Md Ariful Islam handed over the medicines worth 1 million dollars to Minister of Health and Industry Ramesh Pathirana at the Ministry of Health, on Thursday (21).

“We will continue to provide the necessary support for the advancement of the health sector in Sri Lanka, and implement mutual exchange programs in the field of health skills between the two countries,” Bangladesh High Commissioner Tareq Md Ariful Islam said.
Last year, Sri Lanka faced a lack of medication and medical supplies due to its depreciating currency, foreign currency shortage, and default status.

Aside from seeking international assistance to procure essential medications, the Sri Lankan government has made efforts to streamline import processes such as easing bureaucratic hurdles, procuring medicines with shorter shelf life and making speedier customs clearances. (Colombo/Dec22/2023)
